sidebar.name: Ekaterina Ryazanova
sidebar.summary: Frontend developer focused on maintainable UI architecture, performance optimization, and authenticated user flows.

header.title: Overview
header.summary: Frontend developer with commercial experience building React and Next.js applications. Focused on maintainable UI architecture, performance optimization, and robust authenticated user flows.

about.title: About
about.body1: Built internationalized React and Next.js marketing websites (SSR/SSG) from Figma with reusable components and improved Lighthouse metrics.
about.body2: Optimized performance by removing redundant JavaScript chunks, reducing network requests, and improving media delivery; integrated backend APIs with Keycloak authentication and robust loading and error handling.

role1.title: Frontend Developer · EXPLYT, VEAI
role1.summary: Worked on frontend development for a commercial AI-powered IDE plugin, covering SEO-oriented marketing websites and authenticated user interfaces. Built internationalized React/Next.js sites with reusable components; improved Lighthouse metrics, performance, caching, and media delivery; integrated backend APIs and Keycloak auth with robust loading and error handling.

role2.title: Frontend Course Mentor · ITMO University
role2.summary: Mentored undergraduate students in frontend development with a focus on layout correctness, JavaScript fundamentals, and practical engineering skills. Reviewed assignments with structured feedback on semantic HTML, CSS organization, layout accuracy, and JavaScript logic; designed a pixel-perfect layout assignment with automated visual tests.

degree.title: ITMO University, BS in Computer Technologies

courses.title: Relevant Courses
courses.summary: Frontend Development Advanced Course; Web Development; Algorithms and Data Structures; JavaScript Course.

project1.title: React Course Platform
project1.summary: Educational web platform for hosting React courses with hierarchical structure (courses, modules, lectures). Designed a reusable component architecture and implemented typed data access with backend emulation for predictable state management and independent frontend development.

project2.title: Project Management System
project2.summary: Frontend application for managing projects and tasks using board-based workflows. Built status-driven columns with smooth client-side navigation and implemented drag-and-drop flows with search, filtering, async data handling, and robust error states.
